1.text: A man often reproved, hardening the neck, Is suddenly broken, and there is no healing.

2.text: In the multiplying of the righteous the people rejoice, And in the ruling of the wicked the people sigh.

3.text: A man loving wisdom rejoiceth his father, And a friend of harlots destroyeth wealth.

4.text: A king by judgment establisheth a land, And one receiving gifts throweth it down.

5.text: A man taking a portion above his neighbour, Spreadeth a net for his own steps.

6.text: In the transgression of the evil is a snare, And the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

7.text: The righteous knoweth the plea of the poor, The wicked understandeth not knowledge.

8.text: Men of scorning ensnare a city, And the wise turn back anger.

9.text: A wise man is judged by the foolish man, And he hath been angry, And he hath laughed, and there is no rest.

10.text: Men of blood hate the perfect, And the upright seek his soul.

11.text: A fool bringeth out all his mind, And the wise till afterwards restraineth it.

12.text: A ruler who is attending to lying words, All his ministers are wicked.

13.text: The poor and the man of frauds have met together, Jehovah is enlightening the eyes of them both.

14.text: a king that is judging truly the poor, His throne for ever is established.

15.text: A rod and reproof give wisdom, And a youth let away is shaming his mother.

16.text: In the multiplying of the wicked transgression multiplieth, And the righteous on their fall do look.

17.text: Chastise thy son, and he giveth thee comfort, Yea, he giveth delights to thy soul.

18.text: Without a Vision is a people made naked, And whoso is keeping the law, O his happiness!

19.text: By words a servant is not instructed though he understand, And there is nothing answering.

20.text: Thou hast seen a man hasty in his words! More hope of a fool than of him.

21.text: Whoso is bringing up his servant delicately, from youth, At his latter end also he is continuator.

22.text: An angry man stirreth up contention, And a furious man is multiplying transgression.

23.text: The pride of man humbleth him, And humility of spirit upholdeth honour.

24.text: Whoso is sharing with a thief is hating his own soul, Execration he heareth, and telleth not.

25.text: Fear of man causeth a snare, And the confident in Jehovah is set on high.

26.text: Many are seeking the face of a ruler, And from Jehovah is the judgment of each.

27.text: An abomination to the righteous is the perverse man, And an abomination to the wicked is the upright in the way!
